intro: Micromeria juliana var. conferta, commonly known as the denseflowered micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its compact growth habit and dense inflorescences make it a distinctive species within its native range. The variety conferta is distinguished by its more densely packed flower clusters compared to the typical form.
